title: Lost Decades
summary: The Lost Decades (失われた十年, Ushinawareta Jūnen) refers to a period of economic stagnation in Japan caused by the asset price bubble's collapse in late 1991. The term originally referred to the years from 1991 to 2001,[1] but the decade from 2001 to 2011 (Lost 20 Years 失われた20年)[2] and the decade from 2011 to 2021 (Lost 30 Years 失われた30年)[3][4][5] have been included by commentators.[4]
